DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study gather clinical economic evidence use robotics bariatric surgery ( gastric bypass ) . This monocentric , randomize , single blind , control study evaluate post-operative pain , quality life appetite , post-operative complication incidence . It also provide information direct indirect cost surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Health Economic Impact Robot-assisted Surgery v Conventional Laparoscopy : Case Gastric Bypass
DOC.detailed_description: Robot-assisted Surgery Versus Conventional Laparoscopy Bariatric Surgery ( Gastric Bypass ) : prospective , single-blind , randomize , non-inferiority , control study The main evaluation criterion 24h post-operative pain assess use visual analog scale ( VAS ) . Secondary criterion include clinical assessment : post 24h pain , excess weight loss , quality life , appetite , complication , conversion rate ; health-economics assessment : duration surgical step , length stay , return normal activity conversion cost , consumables , estimation indirect cost benefit ( e.g. , robotics perception , publication ) . In study , main inclusion criterion include major obesity ( IMC ≥ 35 ) co-morbidities morbid obesity ( IMC ≥ 40 ) , schedule gastric bypass surgery Main contraindication previous bariatric surgery previous major abdominal surgery To test robotic-assisted surgery non-inferiority VAS pain score 24h post-surgery , total 128 patient ( 64 per arm ) include ( alpha 2,5 % ; power 90 % ; drop-out rate : 5 % ) . The study include 12 month follow-up post-surgery patient . The total study duration 2 year 3 month .
